item.title: 美元跳涨，延续 6 月以来最佳单周连胜势头
item.description: 受唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫的推动，美元周五攀升，延续了一周来的升势，并导致主要货币同行下跌。【原文：The dollar climbed on Friday, extending a weekly advance fueled by Donald Trump’s return to the White House and sending major currency peers tumbling.】

item.title: 人工智能的腾飞让数据中心成为美国新的建筑热潮
item.description: 美国公司在人工智能领域争先恐后，纷纷投入资金建设数据中心。【原文：US companies are plowing money into building data centers as they race to get ahead in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: ASML 遭遇 IT 故障，全球设施瘫痪
item.description: 世界上最先进的芯片制造设备制造商 ASML Holding NV 周五遭遇 IT 故障，影响了其在世界各地的设施。【原文：ASML Holding NV, the maker of the world’s most advanced chipmaking machines, was struck by an IT outage on Friday that affected its facilities around the world.】

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩建议美国液化天然气可替代俄罗斯供应
item.description: 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）有一个减少欧盟对俄罗斯液化天然气消耗量的想法：从美国进口更多液化天然气。【原文：European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has an idea for reducing the bloc’s consumption of Russian liquefied natural gas: import more from America.】

item.title: 展望资本大跌，2017 年以来首次下调股息
item.description: 展望资本公司（Prospect Capital Corp. 是一家公开上市的私人信贷基金，规模达 76 亿美元）的股价周五暴跌超过 16%，此前该公司七年来首次削减了股息。【原文：Shares of Prospect Capital Corp., a $7.6 billion publicly-traded private credit fund, tumbled more than 16% Friday after the firm cut its dividend for the first time in seven years.】

item.title: 博雅银行迫使美国员工将工作场所纠纷诉诸仲裁
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）将要求其美国雇员将几乎所有法律纠纷提交私人仲裁，加入华尔街同业寻求在公众视线之外解决工作场所冲突的行列。【原文：Bank of America Corp. will require its US employees to take nearly all their legal disputes to private arbitration, joining its Wall Street peers that have sought to resolve workplace conflicts outside the public eye.】

item.title: 红色浪潮提升达成协议几率，债务限额紧张局势有望缓解
item.description: 一些华尔街策略师认为，一个潜在的统一的美国政府可能更容易达成协议，在财政部的借贷权限用尽之前暂停或取消债务上限。【原文：A potentially unified US government could make it easier to reach an agreement to suspend or lift the debt ceiling before the Treasury Department’s borrowing authority is exhausted, according to some Wall Street strategists.】

item.title: 墨西哥比索因莱特希泽将领导美国贸易政策的报道而暴跌
item.description: 在《金融时报》报道罗伯特-莱特希泽（Robert Lighthizer）被邀请担任唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）新政府的美国贸易代表后，墨西哥比索的跌幅扩大。【原文：Mexico’s peso extended losses after the Financial Times reported that Robert Lighthizer was asked to be US Trade Representative under Donald Trump’s new administration.】

item.title: 随着进口量骤降，美国对外国汽油的依赖程度减弱
item.description: 美国是世界上最大的汽油消耗国，历来依赖进口来满足部分需求。现在，随着美国燃料制造商的蓬勃发展，对外国供应的依赖程度正在迅速下降。【原文：The US is the world’s biggest gasoline guzzler and has historically relied on imports to help meet some of that demand. Now, the dependence on foreign supplies is quickly falling as the country’s fuel makers hum along.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省在养老金管理人被解雇后任命临时首席执行官
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省政府在周四震惊地解雇了该省养老基金的整个董事会之后，任命了一名长期任职的官员担任该省养老基金管理公司的临时首席执行官。【原文：Alberta’s government named a long-serving bureaucrat as interim chief executive officer of the province’s pension fund manager following Thursday’s shock firing of the entire board.】

item.title: YPF 正与超级巨头洽谈入股阿根廷液化天然气厂事宜
item.description: 阿根廷最大的石油和天然气钻探商、国营 YPF SA 公司正在与全球超级巨头谈判，以成为其液化天然气出口项目的股权合作伙伴，该公司首席执行官暗示马来西亚国家石油公司（Petronas）可能会退出。【原文：Argentina’s biggest oil and gas driller, state-run YPF SA, is in talks with global supermajors to become equity partners in its LNG export project as the company’s chief executive officer hinted that Malaysia’s Petronas may exit.】

item.title: 斯塔达选定首次公开募股账簿管理人，计划明年初启动IPO
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Stada Arzneimittel AG 的私募股权所有者已为这家以消费者健康为重点的制药商可能进行的首次公开募股选定了账簿管理人，并计划于明年初启动交易。【原文：Stada Arzneimittel AG’s private equity owners have selected bookrunners for a potential initial public offering of the consumer health-focused drugmaker with plans to launch the deal early next year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 商业案例重回焦点，特朗普媒体股大幅波动
item.description: 投资者利用唐纳德-特朗普的社交媒体公司为他的连任下注，截至周一，这家亏损公司的估值在他预期获胜之前飙升至近 70 亿美元。【原文：Investors have used Donald Trump’s social media company to bet on his reelection, sending the loss-making company’s valuation soaring to nearly $7 billion as of Monday ahead of his expected win.】

item.title: 贝莱德比特币 ETF 在创纪录的资金流入后超越黄金基金
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc.’s spot-Bitcoin exchange-traded fund has surpassed the size of its gold fund amid record demand for ETFs that invest in the original cryptocurrency.】

item.title: Affirm 首席执行官对假日季前的信贷质量持乐观态度
item.description: Affirm Holdings Inc. 首席执行官马克斯-莱夫钦（Max Levchin）表示，尽管客户拖欠率略高于一年前，但该公司的信贷质量在假日季来临前仍保持弹性。【原文：Affirm Holdings Inc.’s credit quality remains resilient ahead of the holiday season, Chief Executive Officer Max Levchin said, though customer delinquency rates are slightly higher than they were a year ago.】

item.title: 佩雷拉公司总裁认为特朗普的 "轻触 "将带来更多并购交易
item.description: 交易公司佩雷拉-温伯格合伙公司（Perella Weinberg Partners）的负责人表示，特朗普政府对反垄断的轻视将导致并购热潮。【原文：The Trump administration’s lighter touch on antitrust will lead to a boom in mergers and acquisitions, according to the leader of deal-making firm Perella Weinberg Partners.】

item.title: 养老院公司创始人损失数十亿美元，因为兴登堡瞄准了他们
item.description: 本周，一家刚成立不久的养老院运营商 PACS 集团公司发生了剧烈的逆转，其联合创始人的财富损失了约 25 亿美元。【原文：A recently debuted nursing home operator, PACS Group Inc., made a violent reversal this week, erasing around $2.5 billion from its cofounders’ fortunes.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选刺激信贷需求，推动利差降至 1998 年低点
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国总统大选、股市大涨、美联储再次降息，将风险溢价推至 25 年多来最低水平之后，投资者正将资金涌入美国企业债券。【原文：Investors are pouring money into US corporate bonds after Donald Trump won the US presidential election, stocks surged, and the Federal Reserve cut rates again, pushing risk premiums to their lowest levels in more than 25 years.】

item.title: 报告发现加拿大新石油管道价值高达 240 亿美元
item.description: 加拿大政府支出监督机构得出结论，在跨山管道建设成本大幅超支后，该项目仍具有很高的价值。【原文：A project to triple the capacity of the Trans Mountain Pipeline still has a high value after massive cost overruns to build it, Canada’s government spending watchdog concluded.】

item.title: 选举日后网上针对女性的骚扰激增
item.description: 据战略对话研究所（Institute for Strategic Dialogue）称，美国大选后的几天里，网上对妇女的辱骂、骚扰和仇恨飙升，"你的身体，我做主 "和 "滚回厨房 "等短语在 X 和 TikTok 等平台上大量出现。【原文：Online abuse, harassment and hate toward women has soared in the days since the US election, with phrases like “your body, my choice” and “get back to the kitchen” exploding on platforms like X and and TikTok, according to the Institute for Strategic Dialogue.】

item.title: 华尔街美联储观察家调低 2025 年降息预期
item.description: 基于本周唐纳德-特朗普当选总统以及美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔的言论，华尔街的经济学家和策略师们纷纷调低了对美国明年降息的预期。【原文：Economists and strategists across Wall Street have dialed back their expectations for US interest-rate cuts next year based on this week’s presidential election of Donald Trump and comments by Federal Reserve boss Jerome Powell.】

item.description:

item.title: 欧洲央行马克洛夫称无需急于降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员加布里埃尔-马克鲁夫（Gabriel Makhlouf）表示，官员们不应急于放松货币政策。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf said officials shouldn’t hurry in loosening monetary policy.】

item.title: PGIM 聘用摩根士丹利的 Chappuis 接替长期担任首席执行官的 David Hunt
item.description: PGIM 任命摩根士丹利的 Jacques Chappuis 担任首席执行官，接替任职 13 年后即将离职的 David Hunt。【原文：PGIM appointed Morgan Stanley’s Jacques Chappuis as chief executive officer to succeed David Hunt, who’s leaving after 13 years in the job.】

item.title: Tether 为中东主要石油生产国的首笔石油交易提供资金
item.description: 稳定币发行商 Tether 表示，作为成为大宗商品交易借贷方计划的一部分，它完成了在中东的首笔原油交易融资。【原文：Stablecoin issuer Tether said it completed the funding of its first crude oil transaction in the Middle East as part of a plan to become a lender in commodities trading.】

item.title: Invesco Advisers 的 ESG 索赔招致 SEC 1750 万美元罚款
item.description: Invesco Advisers Inc. 将支付 1750 万美元的罚款，以了结美国证券交易委员会的指控，该公司在将环境、社会和治理因素纳入投资决策的全公司管理资产份额方面误导了客户。【原文：Invesco Advisers Inc. will pay a $17.5 million fine to settle US Securities and Exchange Commission allegations that it misled clients about the share of company-wide assets under management that integrated environmental, social and governance factors into investment decisions.】
